name: UPLOAD: The Hint
description:
*Warning. This game contains strong language and questioning about life.

Welcome to "Upload: The Hint", a narrative-driven visual novel from Studio Non Grata. Set in a cyberpunk world, this game follows the story of a detective in the city of Rembark who investigates a mysterious case of missing AIs. These AIs have vanished without a trace, leaving no clues behind.

"Who? When? Where? Most importantly... why? Don't you think it's strange that these artificial intelligences just vanished to the thin air. Don't you think it's stranger that no one talks about the case? Do people see something you don't see? Do they know something you don't know?"


"At least you have your trustworthy companion. AI-DA always watches your back. It's, without any doubt, best purchase  decision you've made. - SUALAT AI (NO REFUNDS)"

"Upload: The Hint" is a demo of Studio Non Grata's upcoming project, showcasing our dedication to creating narrative-driven games that keep players engaged and immersed in the story. The game features stunning artwork and a haunting soundtrack that complements the dark and mysterious atmosphere of the cyberpunk city.

"We apologize for the temporary inconvenience. The product you've looked for is not available for the time. Just............................just........................................."

Are you ready to solve the mystery of the missing AIs? Download "Upload: The Hint" for free and experience a unique and immersive story that will keep you on the edge of your seat.

But be warned, every choice you make will have consequences.

The game features multiple endings based on the choices you make, allowing for replayability and a unique experience with each playthrough. You'll also have the opportunity to build a relationship with AI-DA, unlocking new story paths and revealing hidden secrets.

  1. 5 endings
  2. 9K+ words
  3. 20-30 minutes for each playthrough
  4. Introduction for a deeper lore.

UPLOAD: The Hint is made by two people. You can call us as Saskin and Scalpsol.  We also want to thank niraii for her help in editing character gestures.
